item.title: Kirstin add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Those who believe in telekinetics, raise my hand." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Kirstin add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut Jr.
item.description: "And I urge you to please notice when you are happy, and exclaim or murmur or think at some point, 'If this isn't nice, I don't know what is." -- Kurt Vonnegut Jr.

item.title: Kirstin add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "I am eternally grateful for my knack of finding in great books, some of them very funny books, reason enough to feel honored to be alive, no matter what else might be going on." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Kirstin add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "Poetry is what happens when nothing else can." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Kirstin add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Perhaps I write for no one. Perhaps for the same person children are writing for when they scrawl their names in the snow." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Kirstin add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The story so far: In the beginning the Universe was created. This has made a lot of people very angry and been widely regarded as a bad move." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Kirstin add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "It can hardly be a coincidence that no language on earth has ever produced the expression, 'As pretty as an airport." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Kirstin add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "Hey, you sass that hoopy Ford Prefect? There's a frood who really knows where his towel is." (Sass: know, be aware of, meet, have sex with; hoopy: really together guy; frood: really amazingly together guy.)" -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Kirstin add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "When the last living thing Has died on account of us, How poetical it would be If Earth could say, In a voice floating up Perhaps From the floor Of the Grand Canyon, "It is done." People did not like it here." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Kirstin add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Everything was beautiful and nothing hurt." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Kirstin add a quote by J. D. Salinger
item.description: "Don't ever tell anybody anything. If you do, you start missing everybody." -- J. D. Salinger

item.title: Kirstin add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Hello babies. Welcome to Earth. It's hot in the summer and cold in the winter. It's round and wet and crowded. On the outside, babies, you've got a hundred years here. There's only one rule that I know of, babies-"God damn it, you've got to be kind." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Kirstin add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut, Jr.
item.description: "Do you realize that all great literature is all about what a bummer it is to be a human being? Isn't it such a relief to have somebody say that?" -- Kurt Vonnegut, Jr.
